free_text.Learning outcomes: The course teaches the acquisition of a methodology of designing experiments for optimal quality of the results and of the number of experiments. Specifically the objectives are:[br/][br/][li]To transfer to the student the conceptual basis for designing, performing and analyzing statistical design of experiments[br/][li]To let the student understand the methodology of response surface, with the mathematical concepts that allow the evaluation and the optimization of a matrix of experiments[br/][li]To develop a principle of know-how to evaluate, optimize and analyze design of experiments[br/][li]To develop conceptual understanding of the design of experiments that allows the PhD student to collaborate with statisticians
free_text.Content: [li]Empirical modeling[br/][li]Model with constant coefficient[br/][li]Model with random coefficients[br/][li]Parametric Model[br/][li]Analysis of variance (Anova)[br/][li]Graeco-latin squares designs[br/][li]Matricial treatment of the multilinear regression[br/][li]Factorial designs[br/][li]Fractional Factorial design[br/][li]Hybrid designs[br/][li]Equiradial designs
free_text.Keywords: experimental methodology, optimization of experimental plan, applied statistics, empirical models, sensitivity analysis
free_text.Note: Given during spring semester; block course (2x3 days)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic statistics, Matrix algebra, Matlab and/or Excel

free_text.Remarque: Given during spring semester; block course (2x3 days)

free_text.Prérequis: Basic statistics, Matrix algebra, Matlab and/or Excel
